intro: Uragoga mannagettaei, commonly known as the Malabar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its purple flowers and elliptical leaves that are often hairy in texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical studies.
